intro: Banisteriopsis argentea, commonly known as silver banister, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
